item.title: Ticket #16 (WP should use HTTP headers instead of the META element) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: It should do both in my opinion. Header information is lost when the page is saved on someone's disk (or in Google's cache). Meta information isn't because they are actually part of the document itself. Doing both will not harm you otherwise.

item.title: Ticket #75 (security related user level problem) created
item.dc:creator: Ihad
item.description:
it is undesirable to let any user but the site admin see the database login and password info.

I suggest to add the following line to templates.php in wp-admin directory: line 18: if (stristr($file, 'config') && $user_level < 10) die(('<p>You do not have sufficient permissions to edit config files for this blog.</p>'));

I chose stristr since it is case insensitve.

item.title: Ticket #64 (Advance Editor defaults to Draft) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description: Clicking on "Publish" after writing the article publishes it just fine. I expect that this is normal, desirable behavior. One way of looking at it is, the new post has not been published until you click "publish" as so is a draft till that point of time. Hope that helps.

item.title: Ticket #73 (Tags should be stripped from <title /> element) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
If one creates a tagged post name (i.e., with some BOLDness or an ACRONYM in it), that gets reflected in a <title> element. That *should* be stripped anyways.

I don't think it's hard to do, hence, marking it as "trivial".

item.title: Ticket #38 (More Better Options Regarding Authors) updated
item.dc:creator: JasonV
item.description: You can delete authors from the users area, just reduce their level to 0 then click the red 'X'.

The patch was previously posted to the forums. It's not related to the sebbi.de one.

item.title: Ticket #72 (The search form action refers to the file that contains the search ...) created
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
The search form in the index.php file currently has

Line 77 : <form id="searchform" method="get" action="<?php echo $PHP_SELF; ?>">

Changing that to

Line 77 : <form id="searchform" method="get" action="<?php echo get_settings('blogfilename'); ?>">

will give us an index.php file that can be modified easily by the end user, while preserving a functional search form.

item.title: Ticket #70 (Trackbacks Failing) created
item.dc:creator: gfmorris
item.description: A few days after upgrading to WP 1.2, both internal and external TrackBacks began failing on my 1.2 install â€‹http://ijsm.org/. I TB old entries I reference on my site, so I know the internals are failing; Alex King tried to TB an entry of mine â€‹http://www.alexking.org/blog/2004/06/09/trackback-timestamps/, and that didn't go through, either. Alex would have to speak as to whether he got an error code on the TB; I have no error codes showing up in the ping status.

item.title: Ticket #67 (Call to undefined function: utf8_decode()) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
When trying to install from a clean update from CVS, on step 3 this happens:

Fatal error: Call to undefined function: utf8_decode() in /var/www/html/wordpress/wp-includes/functions-formatting.php on line 114

item.title: Ticket #66 (tracback fails for TB-URIs with querystring) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
file: /wp-incldues/functions.php function: trackback()

If a trackback uri contains a querystring (i.e. â€‹http://foo.net/bar.php?id=00) the trackback fails with a 404 error.

The http_request contains a path and a querystring, but does not seperate them by a questionmark.

Adding a questionmark solves the problem: $http_request = 'POST ' . $trackback_urlpath? . "?" .$trackback_urlquery? . " HTTP/1.0\r\n";

item.title: Ticket #65 (Disable fancy quotes and dashes for some (all?) posts) closed
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
70:

I suggest you look into the remove_filter function, basic encoding of HTML entities, and the use of the my-hacks.php file. It takes just a few lines of remove_filter()s to disable Texturize throughout WordPress and there are a few plugins that already do this.

This is not a bug. Closing.

item.title: Ticket #65 (Disable fancy quotes and dashes for some (all?) posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Guess i should preview more. <something sweet> did really render as <!something sweet> when i pasted it, but the special dashes don't. This was just a trivial example. I hope the bug was self-evident.

item.title: Ticket #65 (Disable fancy quotes and dashes for some (all?) posts) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
There is a formatting function that switches your basic single quote to a nice sloped leading / trailing quote, two hyphens in a row become a nice dash, and so on and so forth.

Anyhow, I like to keep code snippets (unix command line or html fragments) in my blog entries. Then when I need to re-use them, i can just copy and past them. So I had some entries which should have rendered html comment code <!-- something sweet --> that should render nicely into the blog and be copy and pastable. Instead they cut and paste as <something sweet>.

I am now killing it for all posts by editing the file wp-includes/functions-formatting.php

function wptexturize($text) { return $text; .....

So it's annoying, and looks like it should be configurable.

item.title: Ticket #64 (Advance Editor defaults to Draft) created
item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description: After setting the default write style to use "Advance Controls" the Write Post screen defaults the status to "Draft" instead of "Publish" - I thought I had lost a couple of posts because I didn't notice this.

item.title: Changeset [1429]: Death to \r.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Death to \r.

item.title: Ticket #63 (calling of user functions change) created
item.dc:creator: billzeller
item.description:
On line 1093 on wp-includes/functions.php in function apply_filters, the line

$string = $function($string);

should be

$string = call_user_func($function, $string);

This would allow actions to be set as either add_action('publish_post', 'myFunction'); or add_action('publish_post', array('MyClass', 'myFunction'));

Existing plugins would work with this change.

item.title: Ticket #62 (Calendar highlights today in previous year(s)) created
item.dc:creator: Skidde
item.description:
If you load an archive where the calendar shows a different year but the same month as the current one, the same day of the month is highlighted as today.

For example, loading an archive from June 2003 today (June 15, 2004) results in the 15th of the month (2003) being highlighted on the calendar.

item.title: Ticket #60 (Cookie conflict with Wakka Wiki) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Wakka Wiki and WP don't play together well. If Wakka sets a user ID cookie on a domain, this causes index.php to report a "Sorry." The cookies don't share the same name, but they seem to conflict.

item.title: Ticket #55 (Monthly archives links not showing the month) updated
item.dc:creator: JasonV
item.description: I had this happen once, and it was because I was using a non-WP bit of code to generate a count down. It caused problems because my bit of code redefined $month, or something like that.

item.title: Ticket #54 (Stripslashes missing around post title) updated
item.dc:creator: Zarniwoop
item.description: The missing stripslashes is correct but the database is inconsistent. Contrary to all other fields the title is escaped with addslashes by 1.2(.1?). There needs to be a upgrade.php to fix this (don't know how it is done in pre1.2).

item.title: Ticket #59 (WP 1.2 (and 1.2.1 CVS) eating backslashes) created
item.dc:creator: Zarniwoop
item.description:
Everytime when writing or editing a post WP omits one backslash i.e "
" becomes "\" and "\" disappears. The same problem appears when editing comments and the summary. The post title is not affected by this.

item.title: Ticket #58 (ATOM feeds for comments) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: There is no option (functions, templates, etc) for ATOM feeds of permalinks and comments, only RSS (comment_rss() and comments_rss_link()).

item.title: Ticket #18 (Posts created with old versions of WP contain extra slashes) updated
item.dc:creator: Zarniwoop
item.description: I think guessing the time of this upgrade is the major problem. Then you can change all comments newer than this time. Maybe looking at the ctime of some WP files can help (other ideas to make this more reliable?) but it should be left to the user to change this, if he *knows* when he did this upgrade (eventually he has written a post this day, he can remember, ...).

item.title: Ticket #48 (Incorrect functionality in get_nested_categories() in admin-functions.php) updated
item.dc:creator: ophois
item.description:
Hmmm, turns out my suggested fix don't work. Missed a line from second function:

function get_nested_categories($default = 0, $parent = 0) {

global $post_ID, $tablecategories, $tablepost2cat, $mode, $wpdb;

if ($post_ID) {

$checked_categories = $wpdb->get_col("

SELECT category_id FROM $tablecategories, $tablepost2cat WHERE $tablepost2cat.category_id = cat_ID AND $tablepost2cat.post_id = '$post_ID' ");

if(count($checked_categories) == 0) {

No selected categories, strange $checked_categories[] = $default;

}

} else {

$checked_categories[] = $default;

}

$cats = return_categories_list($parent, TRUE); $result = array();

foreach($cats as $cat) {

$result[$cat]children? = get_nested_categories($default, $cat); $result[$cat]cat_ID? = $cat; $result[$cat]checked? = in_array($cat, $checked_categories); $result[$cat]cat_name? = stripslashes(get_the_category_by_ID($cat));

}

return $result;

}

Also added guard against the post having no catagories assigned to it.

item.description: Call update_post_caches() from within query_posts() and get_posts(). â€‹http://mosquito.wordpress.org/bug_view_page.php?bug_id=0000046

item.title: Ticket #57 (typo in wp-admin/options-reading.php) updated
item.dc:creator: gordon
item.description: As above, _('posts') should be _e('posts')

item.title: Ticket #45 (Markdown plugin broken/outdated) updated
item.dc:creator: Zarniwoop
item.description:
The bugfix for the original Markdown included with WP 1.2 can be found at â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/6/6675 . The main problem is that Markdown fails when wptexturize is called first. After these changes it should work.

However I attached a modified version of the new php-markdown 1.0b7 with the bug fixed, filters applied correctly and comment formatting turned off by default (left to wpautop). I tested the whole syntax cheatsheet which can be found at Michel's site: â€‹http://michelf.com/projects/php-markdown/dingus/ and all works fine .

edited on: 06-15-04 02:59

item.description: _('summary') should be _e('summary')

item.title: Ticket #56 (missing translations) created
item.dc:creator: Ihad
item.description:
most of the text strings posted in this thread: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/6/4688 seem to be missing. Esp. Options >> Linkmanager.

I used poEdit and the POT from the WIKI (checked again today 15-06) and also the PHP files from the latest nightly 13-06-2004. The resulting de_De PO and MO files are in the WIKI.

Also, the email that gets sent to the admin when comments are posted do contain garbled ASCII chars when there are apostrophes and umlauts, the email template text also is not translated yet.
